DOC.brief_summary: We hypothesized that in patients with low CHADS-VASc score (2 or < 2), there is no difference in thromboembolic or bleeding events between patients with short term warfarin therapy (2 weeks after catheter ablation) and conventional therapy (3 weeks before and 8 weeks after procedure).
DOC.brief_title: Short Term Warfarin Therapy for Radiofrequency Catheter Ablation of Atrial Fibrillation
DOC.criteria: Patients with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation who underwent radiofrequency catheter ablation Patients with CHADSVASc score 2 or less than 2 Patients who do not consent to the study Permanent or persistent atrial fibrillation Patients who have underwent prior catheter ablation for atrial fibrillation CHADSVASc score more than 2 History of stroke LVEF <40% Significant liver or kidney dysfunction History of major bleeding during warfarin therapy
